title: Safety and health programs for contractors bidding on state construction jobs
context: [ยง396-18] Safety and health programs for contractors bidding on state construction jobs. (a) All bids and proposals in excess of $100,000 for state construction jobs as defined in section 103D-104 shall include a signed certification from the bidder or offerer that a written safety and health plan for the job will be available and implemented by the notice to proceed date of the project. The written safety and health plan shall include: (1) A safety and health policy statement reflecting management commitment; (2) A description of the safety and health responsibilities of all levels of management and supervisors on the job and a statement of accountability appropriate to each; (3) The details of: (A) The mechanism for employee involvement in job hazard analysis; (B) Hazard identification, including periodic inspections and hazard correction and control; &copy; Accident and &ldquo;near-miss&rdquo; investigations; and (D) Evaluations of employee training programs; (4) A plan to encourage employees to report hazards to management as soon as possible and to require management to address these hazards promptly; and (5) A certification by a senior corporate or company manager that the plan is true and correct. (b) Failure to submit the required certification may be grounds for disqualification of the bid or proposal. &copy; Failure to have available on site or failure to implement the written safety and health plan by the project&rsquo;s notice to proceed date shall be considered wilful noncompliance and be sufficient grounds to disqualify the award and terminate the contract.
